PreparerFirmBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1: MORGAN JACOBY THURN BOYLE & ASSOC PA

Name.BusinessNameLine1: VERO BEACH MUSEUM OF ART INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE VERO BEACH MUSEUM OF ART PROVIDES CULTURAL LEADERSHIP AND ENRICHMENT FOR THE PUBLIC THROUGH A WIDE VARIETY OF EDUCATIONAL, STUDIO ART AND HUMANITIES PROGRAMS; A DIVERSITY OF QUALITY EXHIBITIONS; AND THE COLLECTION, PRESERVATION AND PRESENTATION OF IMPORTANT AMERICAN AND INTERNATIONAL WORKS OF ART.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE VERO BEACH MUSEUM OF ART PROVIDES CULTURAL LEADERSHIP AND ENRICHMENT FOR THE PUBLIC THROUGH A WIDE VARIETY OF EDUCATIONAL, STUDIO ART AND HUMANITIES PROGRAMS; A DIVERSITY OF QUALITY EXHIBITIONS; AND THE COLLECTION, PRESERVATION AND PRESENTATION OF IMPORTANT AMERICAN AND INTERNATIONAL WORKS OF ART.
IRS990.Description: exhibitions & collections - The Museum provides cultural enrichment for the public through temporary art exhibitions, exploration in the humanities, professional studio and classroom instruction for all ages, and a permanent art collection. New programs, supported by marketing strategies to reach new audiences are created to encourage increased participation. Exhibitions presented during 2009-2010 included: Holmes Gallery - ROOTED IN TRADITION; Art Quilts from the Rocky Mountain Quilt Museum (attendance 8,653); INNOVATION & CHANGE; Great Ceramics from the Ceramics Research Center, Arizona State University Art Museum Collection (attendance 3,964); SHIPS AND SHORELINES; 19th Century American Marine Painting (attendance 11,824). Schumann Gallery - SANCTUARY; Anna Tomczak Photography (attendance 4,639); Stark Gallery - THE GRID TURNS THE CORNER; A Mid-Career Retrospective of Drawings & Prints by Terry K. Hunter (attendance 2,339); A SECRET LANGUAGE; Sculpture by John Bisbee (attendance 22,375). The Beckwith Sculpture Park - FOOD FOR THOUGHT; Sculpture by Luis Montoya and Leslie Ortiz (attendance 12,611).

Activity2.Description: EDUCATION - THE MUSEUM OFFERS VARIOUS EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC, INCLUDING ART CLASSES, FILM APPRECIATION CLASSES, LECTURES AND SEMINARS, PROGRAMS, WORKSHOPS, AND REFERENCE LIBRARY. DURING THE YEAR SEVERAL CLASSES AND WORKSHOPS WERE HELD, AS WELL AS A SUMMER ART CAMP, WITH TOTAL ENROLLMENT/ATTENDANCE OF 1,561. IN ADDITION, LECTURES, SEMINARS, OPERA STUDIES, AND FILM SERIES WERE HELD, WITH TOTAL ATTENDANCE OF 5,943. DURING THE YEAR VARIOUS SCHOOL PROGRAMS, ADULT PUBLIC PROGRAMS, AND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP OUTREACH PROGRAMS WERE HELD WITH A TOTAL ATTENDANCE OF PARTICIPANTS 12,173.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income: Program service revenue fundraising income other

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: the museum accounts for the acquisition of its art collection as expenditures in the statement of activities in the year in which the art objects are acquired. accordingly, the museum's art collections acquired through purchase or contribution are not reflected as assets in the statement of financial position. proceeds from deaccessions of art objects are recorded as increases in temporarily restricted net assets and are restricted for the acquisition of other art objects.

The permanent collection is central to the mission of the Museum and currently focuses on American art from the 20th to 21st centuries in a broad range of media. There are currently 891 works of art in the collection. The primary goal of the Museum is to provide the public, through its education programs, a deeper level of intellectual and personal understanding of the exhibitions and collections.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The general purpose of the endowment fund is to create sufficient income to permit the building, related structures and operation of the Vero Beach Museum of Art to continue to serve the needs of the community in keeping with the purpose for the Museum set forth in its articles of incorporation.
rent and special events expense netted with revenue: 250495.
rent and special events expense netted with revenue: 250495.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: the museum uses merrill lynch and PNC WEALTH MANAGEMENT to sell donated securities.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Treasurer and Finance Committee has whatever authority as may be designated by the Board of Trustees, including to perform regular, in-depth reviews of the Museum's financial activity and to secure an independent audit annually. The audit firm selected also completes form 990. Upon completion, the CEO and Finance Manager review Form 990 to ensure accuracy, then present the tax return to the Treasurer for review and final approval.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board members are required to submit a disclosure statement on an annual basis.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: the process includes consultation with executive search firms and a review of industry standards and salary surveys provided by AAMD, Art Museum Directors Association.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All documents are available for review upon request. Financial statements are published in the Museum's Annual report. Tax returns are also available on Guidestar.
the process has not changed since the prior year.
